author: usmans.info
content:
<@199561711278227457> <@412614104222531604> Can you point me in right direction please, how can I specify my own Besu log configuration file in the kurtosis configuration? Here is the snippet of my configuration, I am unable to figure out how to use/specify an external logging file for Besu:
```
participants_matrix:
  el:
   - el_type: geth
     el_image: ethereum/client-go:latest
   - el_type: besu
     el_image: hyperledger/besu:develop
     el_log_level: "warn"
     el_extra_env_vars: {"BESU_XENABLE_EXTRA_DEBUG_TRACERS": "true"}
  cl:
   - cl_type: teku
     cl_image: consensys/teku:develop
     count: 1

network_params:
  preset: minimal
```

author: barnabasbusa
content: you can mount an extra configuration file using [el_extra_mounts](https://github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-package/blob/main/README.md?plain=1#L201)

author: usmans.info
content: Thanks mate, that is super helpful. While we are at it, is there a way to deploy changed el_image without doing `kurtosis clean -a`? i.e. I build my besu image and I would simply like to redeploy the changed image instead of bringing the whole network down and bring it up again.

author: barnabasbusa
content: Yes just change the image name and rerun targeting the same enclave name as before

author: barnabasbusa
content:
just make sure you’re using a different local name, like besulocal1
then besulocal2
